message.raw:
IMAQdxCamera: Use smart programming to avoid unnecessary setting of attributes.

Setting attributes can be slow on some cameras.

Subclasses may opt out by setting use_smart_programming = False as a class
attribute for their BLACS tab

message.raw:
Adding a script that helps in calculating minimum recovery time for Basler
cameras depending on camera settings.

Usage is ```python ExposureTiming.py [-sn <camera serial number>]```

If no serial number is provided, it will show all available cameras.

If a serial number is provided, it will apply the default SoftwareTrigger
configuration defined in the Pylon API and then apply settings from the hard-coded
settings_dict in the file. Finally, it reports the Sensor Readout Time, Max
Frame Rate, and minimum time between exposure triggers.

To test different settings, user must change settings in the settings_dict
in the file. Those already listed in the file are the most important for getting
timings right, though other more obscure settings can also change things.
message.html:
Adding a script that helps in calculating minimum recovery time for Basler

Frame Rate, and minimum time between exposure triggers.

To test different settings, user must change settings in the settings_dict
in the file. Those already listed in the file are the most important for getting
timings right, though other more obscure settings can also change things.

values.message:
Adding a script that helps in calculating minimum recovery time for Basler
cameras depending on camera settings.

Usage is ```python ExposureTiming.py [-sn <camera serial number>]```

If no serial number is provided, it will show all available cameras.

If a serial number is provided, it will apply the default SoftwareTrigger
configuration defined in the Pylon API and then apply settings from the hard-coded
settings_dict in the file. Finally, it reports the Sensor Readout Time, Max
Frame Rate, and minimum time between exposure triggers.

To test different settings, user must change settings in the settings_dict
in the file. Those already listed in the file are the most important for getting
timings right, though other more obscure settings can also change things.

message.raw:
Port of IMAQdxCamera device to Pylon API for Basler cameras.
Function and usage is largely identical to IMAQdxCamera device.

Use requires installation of Basler's Pylon SDK with development files as well
as the pypylon package available through pip.

This depends on Pull Request #68.

as the pypylon package available through pip.

This depends on Pull Request #68.

message.raw:
Add stop_acqusition_timeout and exception_on_failed_shot device properties.
This allows waiting more time for acqusition to end in the case of slow download,
and continuing without error if not all images were acquired in a shot.

(it seems that in many common configurations, shots fail, for inexplicable
reasons that might be to do with network traffic hiccups or who know what.
Users tend to want other shots to continue).

Well formatted docstring for device class.

These changes require testing.

This allows waiting more time for acqusition to end in the case of slow download,

Users tend to want other shots to continue).

Well formatted docstring for device class.

message.raw:
make IMAQdxCamera friendier to subclassing. Fixes issue #34

Renamed `imaqdx_attributes` to just `camera_attributes`. No backward
compatibility provided for this, since this class is fairly new.

Allow specifying worker class and camera interface class as class attributes,
in the case that the subclass simply changes these and nothing else about
worker class creation, or about the instantiation of the interface class.

Remove IMAQdx specific code from worker class, into interface class.
message.html:

in the case that the subclass simply changes these and nothing else about
worker class creation, or about the instantiation of the interface class.

Remove IMAQdx specific code from worker class, into interface class.

values.message:
make IMAQdxCamera friendier to subclassing. Fixes issue #34

Renamed `imaqdx_attributes` to just `camera_attributes`. No backward
compatibility provided for this, since this class is fairly new.

Allow specifying worker class and camera interface class as class attributes,
in the case that the subclass simply changes these and nothing else about
worker class creation, or about the instantiation of the interface class.

Remove IMAQdx specific code from worker class, into interface class.

message.raw:
A 'phase_reset' digital quantity is now automatically generated for each pulseblaster DDS, instead of using a user-defined digital output device.
Convenience functions 'hold_phase' and 'release_phase' are hacked on to these DDS decice instances.

Convenience functions 'hold_phase' and 'release_phase' are hacked on to these DDS decice instances.

message.raw:
Resolve issue #33.

Pulseblasters now have a long delay time computed from their core clock freq,
which has been added as an instance attribute to every subclass.
(this is messy, as it is duplicated in the BLACS worker classes too. It should be
passed as a connection table property ideally, but this will have to wait for a
more general 'pulseblaster unification' change I think, along the lines of the
NI DAQ unification).

For each clock tick, the high time is half the clock period if
`pulse_width='symmetric'` (the default), the minimum possible if
`pulse_width='minimum'`, or a fixed value if `pulse_width` is given as a number.

The high time is then clipped to self.long_delay if it is larger, in which case
the pulse_width argument is not honoured, but 57 second high times ought to be
visible on scopes and not too fast for any devices, so this is preferable to
the alternative of adding LONG_DELAY instructions to *both* the high and low
times of the clock ticks.

The low time is then computed as whatever is left, and split into a LONG_DELAY
instruction plus the remainder as an END_LOOP instruction, as before.

If the PulseBlaster has no external clocks for this clock tick, it uses a
LONG_DELAY plus the remainder as a CONTINUE instruction, as before.

instruction plus the remainder as an END_LOOP instruction, as before.

LONG_DELAY plus the remainder as a CONTINUE instruction, as before.

Resolve issue #33.

Pulseblasters now have a long delay time computed from their core clock freq,
which has been added as an instance attribute to every subclass.
(this is messy, as it is duplicated in the BLACS worker classes too. It should be
passed as a connection table property ideally, but this will have to wait for a
more general 'pulseblaster unification' change I think, along the lines of the
NI DAQ unification).

For each clock tick, the high time is half the clock period if
`pulse_width='symmetric'` (the default), the minimum possible if
`pulse_width='minimum'`, or a fixed value if `pulse_width` is given as a number.

The high time is then clipped to self.long_delay if it is larger, in which case
the pulse_width argument is not honoured, but 57 second high times ought to be
visible on scopes and not too fast for any devices, so this is preferable to
the alternative of adding LONG_DELAY instructions to *both* the high and low
times of the clock ticks.

The low time is then computed as whatever is left, and split into a LONG_DELAY
instruction plus the remainder as an END_LOOP instruction, as before.

If the PulseBlaster has no external clocks for this clock tick, it uses a
LONG_DELAY plus the remainder as a CONTINUE instruction, as before.

the data for every image acquired would not be freed.

message.raw:
PY3 fixes.

* Fix incorrect previous fix for concatenating byestrings.
* Set socket type for LightCrafter explicitly
* Ensure indexing bytestrings returns bytestrings on PY3 rather than integers
* Convert an erroneous unicode string to a bytestring.

  • Set socket type for LightCrafter explicitly
  • Ensure indexing bytestrings returns bytestrings on PY3 rather than integers
  • Convert an erroneous unicode string to a bytestring.

* Fix incorrect previous fix for concatenating byestrings.
* Set socket type for LightCrafter explicitly
* Ensure indexing bytestrings returns bytestrings on PY3 rather than integers
* Convert an erroneous unicode string to a bytestring.

message.raw:
Fix issue with IMAQdxCamera - if using a mock device and pynivision installed,
but nivision itself not installed, one got an error on worker startup.
Delay importing nivision to be dependent on mock=False to fix this and raise
the actual import error as it comes.

Fix issue with IMAQdxCamera - if using a mock device and pynivision installed,
but nivision itself not installed, one got an error on worker startup.
Delay importing nivision to be dependent on mock=False to fix this and raise
the actual import error as it comes.

message.raw:
Create blank bmp programatically.
Rejig set_array function so that whether a pixel is white depends on whether
it is nonzero. This avoids potentially dividing by zero when the array is
zero everywhere.

message.raw:
Modify LightCrafter to round up to a multiple of four images that it sends
to the DMD - even though they do not have triggers.

For the model we have, it is a requirement when the number of images is > 24
that there must be a multiple of 2 images, and when > 48, a multiple of four.
We just round up to a multiple of four always.

We just round up to a multiple of four always.

message.raw: Changed DMD behaviour to show black image on startup, since it's too hard for now to get the image stored in the BLACS settings (datatype for the "base_value" column is float, so we'd have to add a new column for strings, or convert all of the other stored values to strings).

message.raw:
* Implement feature of saving an array of images when expose() called multiple
times with identical name and frame type.
* Set default frame_type='frame'.
* Add mock camera class, for testing without an actual camera present.
* Fix bug in continuous acquisition
* Fix bug whereby images were not correctly matched to frames in the case of
  labscript expose() functions being called out-of-order with respect to the
  time of each frame.
*
message.html:
• Implement feature of saving an array of images when expose() called multiple
    times with identical name and frame type.
  • Set default frame_type='frame'.
  • Add mock camera class, for testing without an actual camera present.
  • Fix bug in continuous acquisition
  • Fix bug whereby images were not correctly matched to frames in the case of
    labscript expose() functions being called out-of-order with respect to the
    time of each frame.
    *

  labscript expose() functions being called out-of-order with respect to the
  time of each frame.

summary.html:
• Implement feature of saving an array of images when expose() called multiple
    times with identical name and frame type.
  • Set default frame_type='frame'.
  • Add mock camera class, for testing without an actual camera present.
  • Fix bug in continuous acquisition
  • Fix bug whereby images were not correctly matched to frames in the case of
    labscript expose() functions being called out-of-order with respect to the

values.message:
* Implement feature of saving an array of images when expose() called multiple
times with identical name and frame type.
* Set default frame_type='frame'.
* Add mock camera class, for testing without an actual camera present.
* Fix bug in continuous acquisition
* Fix bug whereby images were not correctly matched to frames in the case of
  labscript expose() functions being called out-of-order with respect to the
  time of each frame.
*

message.raw:
Have DummyIntermediateDevice call parent class's generate_code so that any child
devices will have their generate_code methods called.
Rename parent argument to parent_device in line with other labscript devices.

message.raw:
Use time.perf_counter() instead of time.monotonic(), since time.monotonic has only
~16ms resolution on Windows.

~16ms resolution on Windows.

message.raw:
Ignore ports with no lines in manual mode.

This prevents a crash due to the NI_PCI_6534 having zero lines on port 4.
We could have had the introspection code ingore ports with no lines, but then
the port numbers would not be contiguous, since this device has a port 5.
Easier for now to keep the assumption of contiguous port numbers and simply not
use the ports with no lines. But we may revisit this if there are further
issues with this phantom port 4.

message.raw:
Use a multiple-of-four number of samples per chan to test digital ports, as some
models (observed with PCI 6534) require this.

Use a whole digital port instead of just one line, as some
models (also PCI 6534) require this. Catch errors about requiring multiple ports
at a time for 653x models, and return True since these models do support
buffered output despite these other requirements.

The devices that require the number of samples per channel to be a multiple of
four may be a problem in labscript, since labscript does not know or care about
such requirements presently.

message.raw:
Corrected bug with plural submodule names (blacs_tabs.py referred to blacs_worker),
and used an assertion to provide a more helpful exception when the specified device
is not connected.

message.raw:
Use plural submodule names, i.e. blacs_tabs, blacs_workers, labscript_devices.
Device instantiation should now use
from labscript_devices.TekScope.labscript_devices import TekScope

message.raw:
Require BLACS 2.5.1 for is_remote attribute of worker classes.
Have IMAQdxCamera convert h5 path to local format if it is a remote device
Have IMAQdxCamera use the hostname of the parent process to determine
the zmq connection for sending images.

Have IMAQdxCamera use the hostname of the parent process to determine
the zmq connection for sending images.

message.raw:
Use a dedicated zmq socket for sending image data from worker to parent
rather than using state machine work requests for every frame. Otherwise the GUI
flickers with state changes for every frame, more CPU is consumed per frame,
and the data is serialised using pickle, which is less efficient that using
numpy buffers. This all wastes CPU, limits frame rate, and looks ugly.

This requires some care since the receiving thread must be cleaned up when the
tab restarts. Therefore the tab restart() method is overridden to shutdown the
corresponding ZMQserver.
message.html:

This requires some care since the receiving thread must be cleaned up when the
tab restarts. Therefore the tab restart() method is overridden to shutdown the
corresponding ZMQserver.
